conclusion: Induced EMF in a conductor element moving in a magnetic field is given by dE = (v x B) · dl.
Conductor rod ab rotates at constant angular velocity ω around an axis through point O, distance between a and O is negligible.
Assume rotation is around end a, length of rod ab is 4L.
Let r be the distance from O to a point on the rod, velocity of this point is v = ωr, perpendicular to the rod.
Magnetic field B is uniform and perpendicular to the plane of rotation.
v is perpendicular to B and dl, component of v perpendicular to l is v, and v is perpendicular to B.
Direction of v x B is along the rod towards a for counterclockwise rotation and B into the page.
dl is from a to b, in the direction away from a.
Assume rod is along x-axis, with a at x=0 and b at x=4L, then v x B is in the negative x direction.
dl = dx i, so (v x B) · dl = -ωrB dx, where r=x.
Potential difference Vb - Va = ∫(v x B) · dl from a to b = ∫ from 0 to 4L (-ωxB) dx.
Evaluate integral: -ωB ∫ from 0 to 4L x dx = -ωB [x^2/2] from 0 to 4L.
